turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hey there, I'm looking for some game recommendations. Specifically, I'm really into strategy games right now. Can you suggest a few good ones?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Certainly! Strategy games cover a broad range, but here are a few popular and well-regarded titles across different subgenres:  Civilization VI (turn-based strategy), StarCraft II (real-time strategy), XCOM 2 (tactical turn-based), and Crusader Kings III (grand strategy). Have you played any of these?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Yeah, I've played most of those, they're classics! I was hoping for something a bit different. Maybe something less mainstream? Or perhaps a strategy game that incorporates strong RPG elements? It feels like I've hit a wall finding new stuff I like.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Ah, I understand. Finding that next unique experience can be tricky. For strategy games with RPG elements, you might consider titles like Divinity: Original Sin 2 (though primarily an RPG, it has deep tactical combat), or perhaps Battle Brothers (a turn-based strategy RPG with mercenary management). Another interesting blend is Wartales, which combines strategy, RPG, and exploration.  Would any of those pique your interest?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Ooh, Battle Brothers sounds pretty interesting! I've never heard of that one. Divinity was a bit too much RPG for me last time I tried, and Wartales sounds okay but maybe a bit generic? But Battle Brothers, that's a good shout, thanks! I'll check that out.
